result.execSummary:
The defendant Alondra J. Hernandez Escobedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alondra J. Hernandez Escobedo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alondra J. Hernandez Escobedo was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Alondra J. Hernandez Escobedo was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 2 days, if revoked.
May transfer probation to Illinois.
Eligible for expungement if successfully completes probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge if not already done so.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

01:53 PM
Defendant, Alondra J. Hernandez Escobedo, appeared with Attorney David Saldana.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Cts 1 & 3:
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on concurrent probation for 12 months w/conditions;
2 days sentence credit if revoked.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, if not done so already.
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.
Defendant is eligible for expungement if successfully completes prob. and may transfer
prob. to the State of Illinois.
Appeal rights given.
*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No discussion of case w/Phillip N.
of DNA Collection at Conviction

MINUTES:
Amended Information filed; reading waived.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel Poss w/Intent to Deliver THC-PTAC, Ct 3-Misd BJ, of the amended infro;
Found guilty by the court.  Ct 2 along w/21CM1545 and 21TR9406 & 21TR9107 were all dismissed outright on State's motion.
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.
Parties waived the PSI report.
Bond motion heard.  Court amends the bond conditions to "no discussion of case w/Phillip N.", all other conds continued.
Court does not have time to do a felony sentencing due to court calendar conjestion.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
